title: I have an issue with a PC that can't boot physically and I already checked everything. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: You have not mentioned that what error you face when you boot. You can do some of following steps for boot failure issue- if you receive error boot media not found than, change the boot priority of disks in bios.If there is corruption in boot disk, do the recovery and start up recovery using Windows bootable usb drive.There may also issue of RAM stick, try to remove and clean the ram contacts using eraser, and again insert, change the slot for ram.If BIOS screen is also not displayed, you have to check motherboard physically if there are some capacitor are heated or black. You need to change motherboard or repair if possible. CPU may also need to re install again.If there is no movement of fan and nothing happened than power supply may need to replace.

“Can't boot” is a woefully inadequate description lacking any useable detail. What exactly happens? Are all the components known good/working? Does it boot into the BIOS? Then it's a peripheral issue, SSD/HDD, GPU are forcing it. Do you get any PBIT beeps? They tell you the issue. Is the PSU fully functional? Not just voltage but also check it's not crowbarring. Go back to basics, disconnect everything and reboot. Repeat the checks. Still no joy then reset the BIOS, if the settings have corrupted then it that can prevent everything from working.
